situation.title: Primary schools
situation.meta_description: Personal attendance of children in schools is banned by governmental regulations until November 20th, 2020.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendation

Personal attendance of children in schools is banned by governmental regulations until November 20th, 2020. This means that children can't go to school at this time.

Children are being taught through distance education.

The reason is the current epidemiological situation and a high risk of infection. A lot of children meet in the classroom for a long period of time, they are also in direct contact with their teachers and parents. This is connected to a risk of infection and a lot of people who could potentially be infected.

The exception applies to children of employees of selected professions (e.g. healthcare). For these children, there should be designated schools in their region.

The first stage of elementary school (ages 6-11, první stupeň) is the priority. The children will return to their classrooms as soon as the epidemiological situation allows it.

questions_answers.question: Can children in preparatory classes attend school in person?
questions_answers.value: No, the same rules as for elementary schools apply.
